com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveAuthorityIf

public interface XhiveAuthorityIf

Controls permissions on user objects.

This interface works with the permissions set at group, user, and query level to restrict access to sensitive data.

XhiveAuthorityIf provides methods for getting and setting read, write, and delete permissions at user and group and other(all other users and groups besides the specified users and groups) level. This interface also controls the ownership of objects by users. For example, the setOwner() method sets the owner of an object. You can control access to:

  • Database objects.
  • Libraries.
  • Documents (only the whole document, not individual nodes).
  • All objects that implement the XhiveNamedItemIf interface.
  • Lists containing objects that implement the XhiveNamedItemIf interface.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

setOwnerAuthority

void setOwnerAuthority(int authority)
Set the owner permissions of an object. You need to be the owner, administrator, or super user to do this.

Parameters:
authority - the authority.
Throws:
XhiveException.ACCESS_DENIED - when the user setting the authority is not the owner, administrator, or superuser.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

getAdditionalPermissions

java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Short> getAdditionalPermissions()
Get additional permissions. The additional permissions are a map from XhiveUserIf and XhiveGroupIf objects to java.lang.Short objects with permissions. If the current user or one of its groups matches a key in this map, and the corresponding value allows the operation, it will succeed. In other words, the effective permission is the inclusive or of all the matching entries.

Example: to give the user "me" permission to modify the object "doc": 

 XhiveUserIf me = session.getDatabase().getUserList().getUser("me");
 doc.getAuthority().getAdditionalPermissions().put(me, new Short(XhiveAuthorityIf.READ_WRITE_ACCESS));

Returns:
A map with additional permissions. If you are not the administrator or the owner of the object, the map will be readonly.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.1
